body.p: Which of the following organs receive blood directly from the heart and return it directly to the heart without it passing through other organs?

input.choice: All of these organs follow this general rule.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Although the thyroid does follow this rule, so do most other organs.
Incorrect. Although the pancreas does follow this rule, so do most other organs.
Incorrect. Although the spleen does follow this rule so, do most other organ systems.
Correct. Most organ systems receive blood from the heart and return it directly to the heart without passing another organ.

body.p: What systems are exceptions to the the rule "blood leaves the heart and travels to one organ, exchanges gases, and returns to the heart?"

feedback.p: Incorrect. The blood supply to the spleen and pancreas follows the one organ rule. The hypothalmus/pituitary system is an exception to this rule because of the hormones it needs to have transported.
Correct. All of these organs are an exception to this rule for the purpose of filtration or transport.
Incorrect. The spleen and pancreas are not exceptions to this rule. The liver is because it needs to filter the blood from the gastrointestinal tract.
Incorrect. The thymus and thyroid are not exceptions to this rule. The kidney is because it needs to filter the blood plasma through its nephrons.

body.p: The sympathetic nervous system increases the heart rate by __________.

input.choice: causing the the potassium channels to remain open
releasing acetylcholine from its nerve endings
increasing the rate of action potential firing

feedback.p: Incorrect. The parasympathetic nervous system signals for the potassium channels to remain open which slows down the formation of new action potentials.
Incorrect. The parasympathetic system releases acetylcholine. The sympathetic nervous system releases epinephrine.
Incorrect. The parasympathetic nervous system has a negative chronotrophic effect.
Correct. The positive chronotropic effect of the sympathetic nervous system increases the rate of action potentials which increases the heart rate.

body.p: Which mechanism or system can control both heart rate and stroke volume in its effort to maintain blood pressure?

feedback.p: Incorrect. The renin-angiotensin system can affect stroke volume via changes in preload, but it does not directly affect heart rate.
Incorrect. Anti-diuretic hormone does not affect heart rate and probably rarely affects stroke volume.

Correct. Epinephrine and norepinephrine of the sympathetic nervous system can affect both heart rate through effects on the SA node, and stroke volume via its effects on myocytes, increasing their state of contractility (force of contraction).
Incorrect. Atrial natriuretic factor does not affect heart rate.

body.p: Atrial natriuretic peptide (ANP) reduces blood volume and blood pressure by __________.

feedback.p: Incorrect. If the excretion of salt decreases then the amount of water retained will increase, raising the blood pressure.
Correct. By increasing the excretion of salt, water follows via osmosis and the blood volume is lowered.
Incorrect. ANP dilates blood vessels to lower blood pressure.
Incorrect. Epinephrine is a hormone that will increase the heart rate.
